properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms are possible tonight. Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms late this evening and overnight. These storms may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-06-08T10:06:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-07T22:07:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1202432733.2019
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is expected Saturday as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northern Ontario from the United States. Maximum daytime temperatures are expected to be near 30 degrees Celsius on Saturday with minimum temperatures near 18 degrees Celsius. Cooler air is expected to arrive on Sunday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T03:45:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-07T19:46:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1618716852.2019
Area: Armstrong - Auden - Wabakimi Park, Gull Bay - Black Sturgeon Lake, Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is expected today and Saturday as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northwestern Ontario from the United States. Maximum daytime temperatures are expected to be near 30 degrees Celsius both today and Saturday with minimum overnight temperatures near 18 degrees Celsius. Cooler air is expected to arrive on Sunday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-07T23:57:14-00:00

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: The Evacuation Alert for Marten Beach, Old Smith Highway, Mitsue, Poplar Lane, Fawcett Lake, Eben Road, Bayer Road and areas in the path of the McMillan Fire Complex in the Marten Hills has been lifted as of 9:00 am, June 7, 2019. The State of Local Emergency will expire at 11:22 am today. ### For more information on wildfire status go to srd.web.alberta.ca/slave-lake-area-update.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:58 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is 10 km north of Teulon and is moving northeast at 80 km/h. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-08T00:51:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-07T21:59:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3902365119.2019

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots, frequent lightning and hail. A line of thunderstorms are expected to develop late this afternoon or tonight and move rapidly eastward across the Lakes. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-06-08T10:59:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-07T20:39:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0527664367.2019
Area: Lake Winnipeg - south basin, Lake Manitoba
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires very close to Pickle Lake. These conditions are likely to continue into the weekend. Smoke plumes from a forest fire near Pickle Lake have resulted in deteriorated air quality in the area. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-08T11:59:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-07T20:00:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0337690859.2019
Area: Pickle Lake - Cat Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions have improved however; areas of the wildfire continue to be active and dangerous. The La Crete Ferry Campground will also remain closed until further notice. ### An 8-hour evacuation alert remains in effect for the Town of High Level and the Dene Tha’ First Nation community of Bushe River. Parts of Mackenzie County immediately north and south of High Level will also remain under 8-hour evacuation alert, along with a portion of the Blue Hills/Tompkins area. The Mandatory Evacuation Order has been lifted effective immediately for the area of Blue Hills/Tompkins. The residents west of Range Road 185, north and south of Highway 697 can re-enter their homes but will remain on an 8-hour evacuation alert. An 8-hour evacuation alert remains in effect for the Town of High Level and the Dene Tha’ First Nation community of Bushe River. Parts of Mackenzie County immediately north and south of High Level will also remain under 8-hour evacuation alert, along with a portion of the Blue Hills/Tompkins area. For added information, listen to the local community radio or follow Mackenzie County Facebook page www.facebook.com/Mackenzie-County-262409787134568/ for more evacuation and County updates. For inquiries, please call the Mackenzie County Incident Command Centre at 780-927-3718 during regular office hours of 8:15 AM – 4:30 PM. More information is also available at: - Air Quality - Government of Canada – Public Weather Alerts for Alberta - http://weather.gc.ca/warnings/index_e.html?prov=ab can be found on this website. - Check https://511.alberta.ca/region/Northern%20Alberta#:Alerts for more information on road conditions. - Additional Wildfire information is also available at www.wildfire.alberta.ca website. - Government of Alberta www.emergency.alberta.ca website.
Expires: 2019-06-14T13:12:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency On Behalf of Mackenzie County, 2019-06-07T13:10:07-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5822
Area: Mackenzie #23
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency On Behalf of Mackenzie County

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires. Smoke plumes from a forest fire east of Pikangikum have resulted in deteriorated air quality in the area. East or southeast winds will direct smoke toward Pikangikum today until winds become south this evening. The windshift this evening should direct the smoke away from Pikangikum. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-08T12:00:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-07T20:01:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1646974588.2019
Area: Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:14 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is near Gimli and is moving northeast at 80 km/h. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-08T00:51:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-07T22:15:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0486938877.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for frost formation tonight in low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-08T10:31:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-07T18:32:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1154053593.2019

properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 50 knots, hail of 1 to 2 centimetres and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times are expected or occurring in the area. Strong wind gusts to 50 knots are possible this evening with this line. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
